verses.text: My breath is corrupt, My days are extinct, The graves \add are ready\add* for me.
\add Are there\add* not mockers with me? And \add doth not\add* mine eye continue in their provocation?
Lay down now, put me in a surety with thee; Who \add is\add* he \add that\add* will strike hands with me?
For thou hast hid their heart from understanding: Therefore shalt thou not exalt \add them\add*.
He \add that\add* speaketh flattery to \add his\add* friends, Even the eyes of his children shall fail.
He hath made me also a byword of the people; And aforetime I was \add as\add* a tabret.
Mine eye also is dim by reason of sorrow, And all my members \add are\add* as a shadow.
Upright \add men\add* shall be astonied at this, And the innocent shall stir up himself against the hypocrite.
The righteous also shall hold on his way, And he that hath clean hands shall be stronger and stronger.
But \add as for\add* you all, do you return, and come now: For I cannot find \add one\add* wise \add man\add* among you.
My days are past, My purposes are broken off, \add Even\add* the thoughts of my heart.
They change the night into day: The light \add is\add* short, because of darkness.
If I wait, the grave \add is\add* mine house: I have made my bed in the darkness.
I have said to corruption, Thou \add art\add* my father: To the worm, \add Thou art\add* my mother, and my sister.
And where \add is\add* now my hope? As for my hope, who shall see it?
They shall go down \add to\add* the bars of the pit, When \add our\add* rest together \add is\add* in the dust.
